alert.note: Alert for Anoka; Hennepin (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 15 at 10:45AM CDT until May 18 at 7:00AM CDT by NWS Minneapolis
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Minnesota... Mississippi River At Hwy 169 at Champlin affecting Anoka and Hennepin Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL WEDNESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Mississippi River At Hwy 169 at Champlin. * WHEN...Until Wednesday morning. * IMPACTS...At 11.3 feet, Watercraft restrictions begin. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 930 AM CDT Sunday, the stage was 11.1 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage on Tuesday to a crest of 12.0 feet. It will then fall below flood stage Tuesday afternoon. - Flood stage is 12.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 12.5 feet on 04/29/2001. &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
